alert.note: Alert for Washington; Wilkinson (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 2:01PM EST until further notice by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Georgia... Ocmulgee River near Macon affecting Houston, Twiggs, Monroe, Jones and Bibb Counties. Oconee River near Penfield affecting Oconee, Oglethorpe and Greene Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Georgia... Oconee River at Milledgeville affecting Baldwin, Wilkinson and Washington Counties. Oconee River at Avant Mine near Oconee affecting Wilkinson and Washington Counties. Oconee River near Oconee affecting Johnson, Wilkinson and Washington Counties. For the Ocmulgee River Basin...including Jackson, Juliette, Griffin, Juliette, Macon, Dames Ferry, Macon, Clinchfield, Hawkinsville, Hawkinsville, Byron, Abbeville, McRae, Scotland, Lumber City... Moderate flooding is forecast. For the Oconee River Basin...including Penfield, Milledgeville, Oconee, Oconee, McIntyre, Irwinton, Oconee, Dublin, Mount Vernon... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Oconee River at Avant Mine near Oconee. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 19.0 feet, Minor flooding continues to expand into the woodlands and wetlands along the river upstream and downstream from a gage located by a dirt boat ramp on the west side of Avant Mine off Adams Road in Washington County. The water level will begin to surround the elevated USGS gage house. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1:45 PM EST Thursday the stage was 19.3 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 1:45 PM EST Thursday was 19.3 feet. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 19.3 feet on 03/06/2020. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at weather.gov/atlanta. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 215 AM EST.
